sn1.37:1.2: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling among the Sakyans at Kapilavatthu in the Great Wood together with a great Saṅgha of bhikkhus, with five hundred bhikkhus all of whom were arahants.
sn1.37:1.3: And the devatās from ten world systems had for the most part assembled in order to see the Blessed One and the Bhikkhu Saṅgha.
sn1.37:1.4: Then the thought occurred to four devatās of the host from the Pure Abodes:
sn1.37:1.5: “This Blessed One is dwelling among the Sakyans at Kapilavatthu in the Great Wood together with a great Saṅgha of bhikkhus, with five hundred bhikkhus all of whom are arahants.
sn1.37:1.6: And the devatās from ten world systems have for the most part assembled in order to see the Blessed One and the Bhikkhu Saṅgha.
sn1.37:1.7: Let us also approach the Blessed One and, in his presence, each speak our own verse. ”
sn1.37:2.1: Then, just as quickly as a strong man might extend his drawn-in arm or draw in his extended arm, those devatās disappeared from among the devas of the Pure Abodes and reappeared before the Blessed One.
sn1.37:2.2: Then those devatās paid homage to the Blessed One and stood to one side.
sn1.37:2.3: Standing to one side, one devatā recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.37:3.1: “A great concourse takes place in the woods,
sn1.37:3.3: We have come to this Dhamma concourse
sn1.37:4.1: Then another devatā recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.37:5.2: They have straightened their own minds.
sn1.37:5.3: Like a charioteer who holds the reins,
sn1.37:5.4: The wise ones guard their faculties. ”
sn1.37:6.1: Then another devatā recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.37:7.1: “Having cut through barrenness, cut the cross-bar,
sn1.37:7.3: They wander about pure and stainless,
sn1.37:7.4: Young nagas well tamed by the One with Vision. ”
sn1.37:8.1: Then another devatā recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.37:9.1: “Those who have gone to the Buddha for refuge
sn1.37:9.2: Will not go to the plane of misery.
sn1.37:9.4: They will fill the hosts of devas. ”
